intro: Bhutanthera albomarginata, commonly known as the Bhutan white-margin tree, is a unique species native to the eastern Himalayas. It is characterized by its distinctive white margins on its leaves, which give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Theaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
